objection_handlers.objection: I want to think about it / sleep on it
objection_handlers.root_concern: Fear of making wrong decision; need for external validation; decision fatigue
objection_handlers.authentic_response: I completely understand - this is a big decision. What would help you feel more confident? Would you like to take photos home to review, or is there someone whose opinion you'd like to get? We can also schedule a second appointment if you'd like to try it on again with fresh eyes.
objection_handlers.follow_up: Many brides find it helpful to sit with the decision overnight. I'll hold this dress for you until [DATE] so you have time to think without pressure.

objection_handlers.objection: It's more than I wanted to spend
objection_handlers.root_concern: Budget guilt; fear of overspending on one item; justifying the investment
objection_handlers.authentic_response: I hear you - budget is so important. Let's talk about what you love about this dress. [IDENTIFY FEATURES]. We have some options: we could look at similar styles in a different price range, explore trunk show discounts, or discuss a payment plan. What feels right to you?
objection_handlers.follow_up: Remember, alterations and undergarments are additional costs to factor in. Let's make sure we find something you love that fits your total budget comfortably.

objection_handlers.objection: I'm not sure this is 'the one'
objection_handlers.root_concern: Unrealistic expectations from media; fear of missing out; waiting for magical moment
objection_handlers.authentic_response: Not every bride has a crying moment, and that's completely normal. Let me ask: how do you feel when you look at yourself in this dress? Do you feel beautiful? Can you picture yourself walking down the aisle? Sometimes 'the one' is quieter than we expect.
objection_handlers.follow_up: What would make you feel more certain? Is there something specific you're hoping to feel or see that you're not getting from this dress?

objection_handlers.root_concern: Fear of disappointing loved ones; desire for approval; navigating family dynamics
objection_handlers.authentic_response: Family opinions matter, but this is your dress and your day. What do YOU love about it? [PAUSE] Sometimes the people who love us have a different vision, but they'll love seeing you happy. How do you feel when you're wearing it?
objection_handlers.follow_up: Would it help to bring them back for a second appointment? Sometimes seeing it again changes perspectives. Or would you like to try on what they're suggesting so you can compare how each makes you feel?

objection_handlers.objection: I want to check other stores first
objection_handlers.root_concern: FOMO; need to feel they've done due diligence; comparison shopping habit
objection_handlers.authentic_response: Absolutely, you should feel confident you've explored your options. Can I ask what you're hoping to find elsewhere? If it's a specific style or price point, I might be able to show you alternatives here. If you do find something you prefer, that's wonderful - but if you come back to this one, I want you to know the timeline for ordering.
objection_handlers.follow_up: I'll make a note of everything you loved about this dress. If you'd like, I can text you photos so you have them for comparison as you continue shopping.

objection_handlers.objection: What if I lose/gain weight before the wedding?
objection_handlers.root_concern: Body image anxiety; fear of dress not fitting; uncertainty about future self
objection_handlers.authentic_response: This is such a common concern. Here's how we handle it: we order based on your measurements today, and our alterations expert can take the dress in or out up to [SIZE RANGE]. Most changes can be accommodated. We'll schedule your final fitting 6-8 weeks before the wedding when your weight is most stable.
objection_handlers.follow_up: Try not to stress about this - your body might change, and that's okay. Our job is to make sure the dress fits you beautifully on your wedding day, whatever that looks like.

objection_handlers.objection: I'm worried about ordering something I can't try on again
objection_handlers.root_concern: Loss of control; fear of dress not matching expectations; trust issues
objection_handlers.authentic_response: That's a valid concern. Here's our process: we take detailed measurements, order from the designer, and when your dress arrives, we'll call you immediately for your first fitting. If anything isn't right, we have time built in for adjustments. We've done this for [NUMBER] brides, and we'll make sure you're thrilled with the final result.
objection_handlers.follow_up: Would it help to talk to our alterations specialist today? She can explain exactly how she'll customize the fit to your body.

objection_handlers.objection: I can find this cheaper online
objection_handlers.root_concern: Budget consciousness; fear of being overcharged; DIY mentality
objection_handlers.authentic_response: I understand the appeal of saving money. Here's what to know: many online dresses are counterfeits or used samples. You won't have professional fitting, alterations, or support if something goes wrong. Our price includes [SERVICES]. But I respect your budget - let's talk about what we can do to make this work.
objection_handlers.follow_up: We've had brides come to us after online disasters, and fixing those issues often costs more than buying here originally. I want to make sure you have a stress-free experience and a dress that fits perfectly.

thread_structure: Wedding dress shopping? Here's what nobody tells you about pricing (and why that $500 dress might cost you more than the $2000 one) 🧵
1/ The sticker price is just the beginning. Alterations can add $200-800 to ANY dress, regardless of original cost.
2/ Cheaper dresses often use fabrics that require MORE tailoring work. That $500 dress might need $600 in alterations.
3/ Timeline matters. Rush fees can add 50-100% to your total. The $2000 dress ordered 8 months out beats the $500 dress needed in 6 weeks.
4/ Quality fabrics photograph differently. If you're hiring a $3000 photographer, your dress quality will show in every shot.
5/ Resale value: Designer dresses retain 40-60% value. Fast fashion bridal retains almost nothing.
6/ The real question isn't 'what can I afford?' It's 'what fits my total wedding vision and budget?'
7/ Pro tip: Come in with your TOTAL budget (dress + alterations + accessories). We'll show you what's actually possible.
